program: Sastera Sains Sosial (Social Sciences and Humanities)
subject: Social Studies

overview.description: Comprehensive social studies curriculum exploring Malaysian society, governance, civil rights, social issues, and global citizenship for active democratic participation

learning_objectives: Understand Malaysian political system and governance structures
Analyze social issues and their impact on communities
Develop civic responsibility and democratic participation skills
Evaluate human rights and social justice concepts
Apply critical thinking to contemporary social and political issues

units.title: Malaysian Political System and Governance
learning_outcomes: Understand the structure and function of Malaysian government
Analyze the federal system and state-federal relations
Evaluate the role of political parties and elections
Assess the implementation of democratic principles

lessons.title: Federal Constitution and Democratic Principles
objectives: Understand the key provisions of the Federal Constitution
Analyze the separation of powers and checks and balances
Evaluate the protection of fundamental rights

activities.description: Analyze key articles of the Federal Constitution
Map the separation of powers between executive, legislative, and judicial branches
Study landmark cases involving fundamental rights
Apply constitutional principles to current issues

lessons.title: Elections and Democratic Participation
objectives: Understand the electoral system and voting processes
Analyze the role of political parties and campaigns
Evaluate factors affecting voter participation and choice

activities.description: Simulate a general election with campaigning and voting
Analyze political party platforms and ideologies
Study factors affecting voter turnout and engagement
Brainstorm ways to improve democratic participation

cross_curricular_connections: Mathematics: Statistical analysis of election data

units.title: Social Issues and Community Development
learning_outcomes: Identify and analyze major social issues in Malaysian society
Understand the causes and effects of social problems
Evaluate government and community responses to social issues
Develop skills for community engagement and social action

lessons.title: Poverty and Economic Inequality
objectives: Understand the nature and extent of poverty in Malaysia
Analyze factors contributing to economic inequality
Evaluate poverty reduction programs and their effectiveness

activities.description: Analyze poverty statistics and income distribution data
Map local poverty indicators and affected communities
Evaluate government poverty reduction programs like BR1M
Brainstorm additional solutions to address poverty

cross_curricular_connections: Economics: Income distribution and welfare policies
Geography: Spatial patterns of poverty and development

lessons.title: Environmental Justice and Sustainability
objectives: Understand environmental challenges facing Malaysian communities
Analyze the unequal distribution of environmental impacts
Evaluate community responses to environmental issues

activities.description: Investigate environmental justice cases like Lynas and palm oil
Assess environmental impacts on different communities
Plan community advocacy campaigns for environmental protection
Commit to personal environmental actions

cross_curricular_connections: Environmental Science: Pollution and ecosystem health

units.title: Human Rights and Social Justice
learning_outcomes: Understand universal human rights principles and Malaysian context
Analyze issues of discrimination and marginalization
Evaluate mechanisms for protecting and promoting rights
Develop advocacy skills for social justice causes

lessons.title: Universal Human Rights and Malaysian Implementation
objectives: Understand the Universal Declaration of Human Rights
Analyze Malaysia's human rights record and commitments
Evaluate gaps between international standards and local practice

activities.description: Study key articles of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights
Compare international standards with Malaysian laws and practices
Identify areas where implementation can be improved
Plan actions to promote human rights awareness

cross_curricular_connections: Law: International and domestic human rights law

lessons.title: Indigenous Rights and Cultural Preservation
objectives: Understand the rights and challenges of indigenous communities
Analyze threats to indigenous lands and cultures
Evaluate efforts to protect indigenous rights and heritage

activities.description: Profile different indigenous communities and their challenges
Analyze indigenous land rights and cultural protection laws
Design a cultural preservation project proposal
Discuss ways to show solidarity with indigenous communities

units.title: Global Citizenship and International Relations
learning_outcomes: Understand Malaysia's role in international organizations
Analyze global challenges and collaborative responses
Develop global perspective and intercultural competence
Apply principles of global citizenship to local and international issues

lessons.title: Malaysia in ASEAN and Global Organizations
objectives: Understand Malaysia's membership and role in international organizations
Analyze benefits and challenges of international cooperation
Evaluate Malaysia's foreign policy priorities and strategies

activities.description: Map Malaysia's membership in international organizations
Analyze Malaysia's foreign policy positions on key issues
Evaluate the effectiveness of international cooperation
Envision Malaysia's future role in global affairs

cross_curricular_connections: Economics: International trade and economic cooperation
Geography: Regional and global spatial relationships

lessons.title: Global Challenges and Sustainable Development
objectives: Understand major global challenges like climate change and inequality
Analyze the Sustainable Development Goals and their implementation
Evaluate individual and collective responses to global challenges

activities.description: Research a specific global challenge and its local impacts
Map SDG targets to local and national development priorities
Design a project addressing a global challenge locally
Make personal commitments as global citizens

core_experiments: Survey research on community social issues
project_work: Community needs assessment and action plan

digital_resources: Government and NGO websites and databases
Current affairs and news analysis tools

career_connections: Public policy analyst and government officer
Human rights advocate and NGO worker

cross_curricular_integration.geography: Spatial dimensions of social and political issues
